intro: Epilobium latiusculum, commonly known as narrowleaf willowherb, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and stream banks. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, pink to red flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is an herbaceous perennial that can reach heights of up to 1 meter.
